title: Thunderbird updated this morning and promptly failed to restart
content:
Thunderbird did an auto update this morning and failed to restart. I get a message that says this version is incompatible with the last. I pay over 20 bills from folders I created in it the applications inbox, house billing info and passes and links to the pages and responses, etc. This is a MUST for me that this thing works and works well. Until this morning it was flawless in that capacity. My only fix after extensive research has been to download the newest version from the website, install it and it starts fine...until I close it, then it fails to restart with the same identifier. Each of the two times I have closed it I go through the same thing upon an opening attempt.

I'm now looking at different mail options as I'm on SSI and have one shot at paying bills a month and can't afford to be any later than SSI already makes me, though my creditors have been thus far understanding. I now have to keep my computer on and the app open until I'm paid on the 9th so I can be sure to be able to pay my bills. I don't know what you folks are shooting for by tinkering with an already flawless system but you missed this time I'm afraid. Leave it alone or let us keep our working system while you offer "new and improved" to those who like to play with new toys. Give me back my old working system before I'm forced to look elsewhere for a way to do my monthly duty to my creditors. Sincerely, Arthur Kelly
creator: arthurkelly

title: calendar tab always opens at startup
content:
After an update a few months ago, all installations of thunderbird always open the calendar tab when the program starts. Previously, calendar tab only opened if I opened it (or maybe if it was left open when last shut down, idr now, sorry). This is only a nuisance, having to close the tab each time I start tbird.

I didn't post about this immediately, as I figured others would experience the same issue (or related) and devs would fix the problem. But it has been several months now and this does get to be annoying. I know that merely clicking a close button shouldn't be that big a deal, but I don't understand why this would become the default; moreover, why there doesn't seem to be any way to disable the calendar or at least modify this new behavior.

I've been using tbird for at least a decade and found it to be reasonably simple to use. I use the calendar function, but only for some installations. I would appreciate being able to change the behavior of the startup or maybe just disable calendar altogether where it isn't needed.

Thanks.

title: Add-on or code so Thunderbird's blue "Home" icon stays forever on Windows taskbar please
content:
Hi, I am writing on behalf of an elderly user who sometimes closes Thunderbird windows when making their way to other Thunderbird windows or Tabs which are open. This sometimes leads to the situation where, in the Windows taskbar, there is no blue Thunderbird icon visible, but there are Thunderbird Write icons visible (the black-coloured fat pencil icon). The problem is that the "Launched" or "Home" icon can vanish from the Taskbar even when the Thunderbird program is open, such as for writing an email.

This person's workflow requires the blue icon to be stable - it should never disappear from the Taskbar, even if certain Thunderbird windows are closed. I have tried explaining the logic and what to do, but after decades of using "forever stable" email software and their permanent "stable Home icons are always to be found in the Taskbar" I am unable to change the users' expectations about usability.(I am providing family IT support for my elderly parents and others.)

I would like to implement a script or install an add-in which ensures that the blue Thunderbird "Launched" or "Home" icon is permanently welded to the Taskbar, like a limpet, in all circumstances.

This "Sticky blue Home Thunderbird icon in the Taskbar" would be an acceptable usability outcome even if it means computer performance is degraded by allowing users to open multiple instances of Thunderbird.

Put plainly, they want it more and if performance is the price to pay, they will accept that price.

Is any such script available? Is there a switch in the coding I can change to enable stickiness? Is there an Add-In which can achieve this outcome? Is there any other path to the desired solution?

Thank you for your time considering this and solutions.
creator: mizlist

title: Blank white box in source veiw
content:
This is a very strange issue. Some of the messages in my inbox, when selected do not display the message itself. Blank box. I looked at the message source and there is nothing displayed but white space in the box. The messages that are not displaying are before 3 August 24 and back in time to the year 2018. Those messages received in 2018 appear correctly.

Messages received after midnight (12:01 AM) 3 August display fine. Message source view displays the contents.

On that computer, I have other email accounts that display the messages correctly. Nothing missing. So whatever happened, only one email address account was affected. It is like something deleted that data.

Running Windows 10 Pro and latest version of Thunderbird. No extensions

Anyone that can inform me as to what might have caused this and tell me if it can be fixed, I would be greatly appreciative.

Thank you

title: Reinstall Thunderbird gives me back the original which doesn't work properly
content: At about the time of the most recent update to Thunderbird my wife's computer started running Thunderbird all wrong. A large chunk of old messages vanished, but not the oldest, and when she deletes a message it vanishes instead of going into a Deleted file. The old messages are still on the server, but Thunderbird will not download them again, I assume because it thinks she already has them. They are there, though. I installed her email on my version of Thunderbird and it promptly downloaded all 330 of them. I assumed something went wrong in the update so I thought if I uninstalled Thunderbird and reinstalled it, all would go back to normal. I have done so with both a warm and a cold reboot after uninstalling and in both cases when I open Thunderbird, there is her account, faults and all. So the question is "How do I get rid of Thunderbird completely, so that it needs the mail-box reloaded as well?" It is beyond me why what I have done doesn't work. Is there some other way to get the program working like it used to? My wife is about as technophobic as they come and takes a long time to learn something new so please can we go back to the way we were? We are both in our 80s so new tech is sometimes a challenge. Any help you can give us, in simple language please, would be appreciated. I don't want to convert her to Access as I have never used it and wouldn't know how to teach her. Thank you, Peter
creator: 81ph.lloyd

title: thunderbird no me envía correos de outlook
content:
Microsoft logo

El 16 de septiembre de 2024, las aplicaciones que están usando una tecnología de inicio de sesión menos segura ya no podrán acceder a tu correo.

La protección y seguridad de la información son prioridades principales de Microsoft. Para proteger tu cuenta, Microsoft ya no admitirá el uso de aplicaciones de calendario y de correo electrónico de terceros que soliciten que inicies sesión solo con el nombre de usuario y la contraseña de la cuenta de Microsoft. Para seguir teniendo más seguridad, es necesario que uses una aplicación de calendario o de correo electrónico que admita los métodos de autenticación modernos de Microsoft. Si no haces nada, las aplicaciones de correo electrónico de terceros ya no podrán acceder a tu dirección de correo electrónico de Outlook.com, Hotmail o Live.com a partir del 16 de septiembre de 2024.

¿Qué tienes que hacer?

Si recibes este correo electrónico, actualmente estás usando una aplicación de calendario o de correo electrónico que usa un método de autenticación menos seguro para conectarse a tu cuenta de correo electrónico de Outlook.com. Será necesario que actualices la aplicación de calendario o de correo electrónico de terceros a una versión que admita los modos de autenticación modernos.

Microsoft proporciona versiones gratuitas de Outlook para PC, Mac, iOS y dispositivos de Android que pueden descargarse fácilmente y conectarse a tu cuenta de correo electrónico. El uso de una versión actualizada de una aplicación de Outlook garantiza que te conectes de la forma más segura.

¿Cómo puedes configurar tu aplicación de correo electrónico de Gmail, Apple Mail o de otros terceros?

Algunas aplicaciones que no sean de Microsoft tendrán sus propios pasos para conectarse a tu cuenta de correo electrónico de Outlook.com usando métodos de autenticación modernos. Consulta el artículo de ayuda: Métodos de autenticación modernos ahora necesarios para seguir sincronizando el correo de Outlook en aplicaciones de correo que no sean de Microsoft. Sin embargo, es posible que necesites ponerte en contacto con los creadores de esas aplicaciones para que te den instrucciones. En muchos casos, con solo eliminar la cuenta y volver a agregarla en la versión más actualizada de esa aplicación ya la configurará para usar los métodos de autenticación modernos.

Declaración de privacidad

Microsoft Corporation, One Microsoft Way, Redmond, WA 98052 USA

Que debo hacer para actualizar esto que les envío. Muchas Gracias
